poem:
**The Hotel's Whisper**

In the opulence of white petals  
lies a shadow—  
a promise of departure,  
as laughter veils unease.  
The sun sets heavy,  
a slow ripple in the pool—  
who vanishes first within  
this isle of shifting sand,  
where calm masks  
the wild undertow?
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Checking out early: who is going to die in this season of The White Lotus? After a characteristically slow start, we are now halfway through this year’s season of The White Lotus. From what we know of the last two seasons, this means that things are about to get very crazy very quickly. To use season one as a way marker, we are now approximately the runtime of The Brutalist away from watching someone perform". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
